content: Generally, when porting, should tactics that live in mathlib4 be imported one by one at the top of the file? E.g. one ported proof needs the tactic set (as well as some others), so should I stick import Mathlib.Tactic.Set at the top of the file (and likewise for the rest)? Or should Mathlib.Tactic be imported all at once?
I've been doing minimal imports, because why not? When teaching I just import tactic on line 1, but I think in mathlib3 we tended to be more minimal.
Thomas Murrills has marked this topic as resolved.
